column2: Southern Nevada Culinary & Bartenders Pension Plan
column3: UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund (Seattle/WA)
column4: San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders & Service Employees Pension Plan
column5: Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant & Tavern Employees Pension Plan

column2: "Effective July 2020" (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 5, 1)
column3: "Effective June 1, 2005" (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 1, 2)
column4: "December 2018... This Plan is hereby restated and amended as of January 1, 2015" (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 19, 2)
column5: "SEPTEMBER 2016" (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 1, 4)
column6: "EFFECTIVE DECEMBER 1, 2020" (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 1, 3)

column2: "Plan Year (which is a calendar year)." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 6, 5)
column3: "The plan year is June 1 to May 31." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 23, 4)
column4: "“Plan Year” means the period from April 1 through March 31 of the following year." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 22, 4)
column5: "The Plan Year commences on June 1 and ends on May 31." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 33, 2)
column6: "The Plan Year for this Plan is the 12-month period beginning January 1st and ending December 31st." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 28, 7)

column2: "You automatically become covered on the first day Contributions are made or required to be made on your behalf by a Contributing Employer, provided you have 300 Hours of Service during the Plan Year (which is a calendar year)." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 6, 5)
column3: "You automatically participate in this plan if your employer is required to contribute to it on your behalf... You also participate in this plan if your employer is required to contribute to it on your behalf according to a special agreement with the Trustees." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 31, 1-2)
column4: "You will become a Participant of the Plan when you have worked sufficient time as provided in the collective bargaining agreement under which you work, to have three (3) months of Employer Contributions made within a Plan Year... The date your Participation commences is the first of the month following the month that you complete the third month, even if no Contribution is received on your behalf for that month." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 3, 6)
column5: "You become a Participant in the Plan on the earlier of: a. the first day of the month after you have had Employer Contributions made on your behalf for at least five calendar months in a Plan Year; or b. the June 1 or December 1 coincident with or immediately following the date you complete at least 1,000 Hours of Service in a period of twelve consecutive months beginning with your initial date of coverage." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 7, 4-5)
column6: "If you are working in a job classification covered by the terms of a collective bargaining agreement that requires contributions to this Plan on your behalf, you will become a Participant on the date you are credited with three hundred (300) Hours of Service in the Plan." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 11, 6)

column2: "Five Year Vesting - If you have worked at least one hour in Covered Employment on or after January 1, 1997 your Pension Credits become 100% Vested, no matter what your age, when you have five full years of Pension Credit and have not incurred a Permanent Break in Service..." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 17, 4)
column3: "You will become vested after you: Have five years of service including one year of credited future service; OR You may also become vested if you qualify for retirement when you reach “normal retirement age” — age 65 — if you have reached the 5th anniversary of plan participation and you have at least 400 hours of service during the current plan year." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 33, 4)
column4: "For Participants employed pursuant to a collective bargaining agreement on or after April 1, 1998, you become 100 percent vested when you accumulate five (5) years of Vesting Service without an intervening Permanent Break in Service or upon attaining Normal Retirement Age..." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 8, 5)
column5: "To be vested and retire with a Normal Retirement Benefit upon reaching age 65, and the earliest of the following has occurred: (1) you worked one or more hours in Covered Employment on or after June 1, 1999, and you have been credited with at least 5 years of Vested Pension Credit in the Plan... or (2) the 10th anniversary of the year in which your participation in the Plan commenced; or (3) the later of age 65 and the fifth anniversary of your participation in the Plan after June 1, 1988..." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 8, 3)
column6: "You will be vested when you have five (5) or more Vesting Years of Service in the Plan on and after January 1, 1996. You also become vested when you become eligible for a Normal Pension." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 24, 2)

column2: "REGULAR RETIREMENT - AGE 62 - You will be eligible for a Regular Pension at age 62 with 5 years of Pension Credit, provided that you worked at least one covered hour on or after January 1, 1997 and were not already receiving pension benefits as of September 11, 1997." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 6, 7)
column3: "Your normal retirement date is the first day of the month that coincides with or immediately follows your 65th birthday. To be eligible for normal retirement at that time, you must be vested." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 35, 4)
column4: "You will become entitled to a Normal Pension Benefit if you are at least age 65, have retired and terminated employment, and have completed one (1) of the following: (a) You have completed at least one (1) hour of service on or after April 1, 1998 and have completed at least five (5) years of Vesting Service without an intervening Permanent Break in Service..." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 4, 4)
column5: "You may retire with a Normal Retirement Benefit upon reaching age 65 and the earliest of the following has occurred: (1) you worked one or more hours in Covered Employment on or after June 1, 1999, and you have been credited with at least 5 years of Vested Pension Credit... (2) the 10th anniversary of the year in which your participation in the Plan commenced; or (3) the later of age 65 and the fifth anniversary of your participation in the Plan after June 1, 1988..." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 14, 3)
column6: "You are eligible for a Normal Pension at your Normal Retirement Date. Your Normal Retirement Date is the later of age sixty-five (65), or the fifth (5th) anniversary of your Participation in the Plan after January l, 1988 (excluding years in which a Break in Service occurred)." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 17, 3)

column2: "EARLY RETIREMENT - AGE 55-61 - You will be eligible for an Early Retirement Pension at age 55 with 5 years of Pension Credit, provided you worked at least one hour on or after January 1, 1997 and were not already receiving pension benefits as of January 1, 1998." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 7, 3)
column3: "You may retire as early as the first day of any month after your 55th birthday if you have: • At least 10 years of credited service, including at least 5 years of credited future service." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 36, 4)
column4: "You may elect an Early Retirement Pension Benefit if you retire from the industry on and after age 62 and before age 65, provided you have completed at least ten (10) years of Vesting Service without a Permanent Break in Service." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 4, 5)
column5: "You may retire on or after the Plan’s Early Retirement Date, which is the date: (1) you have terminated your Covered Employment; (2) you have attained at least age 62; and (3) you have earned at least 10 years of Vested Pension Credit, without a permanent break in service, of which 2 years must be Future Service Credit." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 14, 7)
column6: "You are eligible for an Early Pension at your Early Retirement Date. Your Early Retirement Date is the first day of any month on or after age fifty-five (55) if you have ten (10) years of Past and Future Service... or, if an Employee has at least one (I) hour of Covered Employment on or after June 1, 1996, five (5) or more Vesting Years of Service." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 17, 5)

column2: "You calculate your Early Pension Benefit the same as your Regular Pension Benefit. You then reduce the Regular Benefit by: (A) 0.75% per month for each month that your Early Pension precedes age 62 if you retire on or after age 60, but prior to age 62; and (B) An additional 0.50% per month for each month that your Early Pension precedes age 60 if you retire on or after age 55, but prior to age 60." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 12, 2-4)
column3: "Age 60 Early retirement reduction factors 70%... Age 55 Early retirement reduction factors 40%... The new factors only apply to participants who have not worked at least 400 Covered Hours in any one of the plan years ending May 31, 2011, May 31, 2012 or May 31, 2013." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 12, 1-3)
column4: "The amount payable to you on Early Retirement will be equal to the Normal Pension to which you would be entitled if you attained Normal Retirement Age (in most cases, age 65) when you retired reduced by 6/10 of 1 percent for each month that you are younger than Normal Retirement Age on the date that you are first entitled to receive an Early Retirement Pension." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 10, 1)
column5: "You calculate your Early Retirement benefit in the same way that you calculate your Normal Retirement Benefit (as if you retired at age 65) except the benefit is then reduced by one-half of 1% (.5%) for each month by which the month of your actual retirement precedes the month in which you would attain age 65." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 14, 10)
column6: "However, since your benefit is expected to be paid for a longer period of time than if you waited until your Normal Retirement Date to start benefits, your benefit will be reduced by one-half (½) of one percent (1%) for each month that your Early Retirement Date precedes your Normal Retirement Date." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 17, 6)

column2: "Service Requirements: To be eligible for a Disability Pension, you must have earned (i) at least five (5) years of Pension Credit, and (ii) a total of at least 300 hours during the period which includes the calendar year of your disability and the year before the disability." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 12, 8)
column3: "You will be eligible for disability retirement if you meet the following requirements... You became totally and permanently disabled... Your disability has continued for 6 consecutive months or your Social Security disability payments have begun, You have 10 years of service, including at least 1 year of credited future service... [REHAB PLAN:] For retirements after May 31, 2013, disability will be eliminated for retirements at ages 55 and older." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 45, 2; 9, 7)
column4: "If you have at least fifteen (15) years of Vesting Service without an intervening Permanent Break in Service and are totally disabled (as defined in the Social Security Act or as determined by the Trustees based upon other relevant evidence of disability), you will be entitled to a benefit when you reach age 55." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 10, 2)
column5: "This Plan does not provide a Disability Benefit." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 13, 10)
column6: "You are entitled to a Disability Pension if you provide evidence of a Social Security Disability Benefit and meet all of the following requirements: 1. Have been credited with at least five thousand (5,000) hours in the industry... 2. Have accrued at least ten (10) years of Past and Future Service Credit... or have at least one (1) hour of Covered Employment on or after January l, 1996 and have accrued five (5) or more Vesting Years of Service..." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 17, 9; 18, 1-2)

column2: "2000 and over [hours]... Earned Monthly Benefit on or after 2016... $37.83... The Board of Trustees... has approved an increase in pension benefits for all active participants by 10%." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 9, 2; SMM Feb 2017, 1, 2)
column3: "Specifically, the monthly benefit accrued for employer contributions on hours accumulated after May 31, 2009 will be reduced from 3.3% of contributions to 2.5% of contributions... The monthly benefit accrual for employer contributions on hours accumulated after June 1, 2010 will be reduced from 2.5% of contributions to 1% of contributions." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 23, 3; 19, 2)
column4: "The 4-Year $50 Window VII Benefit shall also be available to Participants who meet the following requirements: You must have earned at least three months of pension credit in the Plan’s 2018-2019 “Plan Year” or any time thereafter with one or more employers who are paying for the “4-Year Window VII Benefit”... The 6-Year $50 Window VII benefit shall also be available... In order to increase the pension benefits of union members and employees, certain employers and Local 2 also negotiated a Permanent “$45 Level VII Benefit.”" (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, SMM p. 2, 1; SMM p. 2, 5; SMM p. 3, 6)
column5: "(e) After June 1, 2003. 2.00% of all Employer Contributions made or due on behalf of an Employee for each Plan Year beginning on and after June 1, 2003, in which the Employee is credited with at least five (5) months of Employer Contributions." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 16, 5)
column6: "For retirements effective on or after January 1, 2008, the amount of a Normal Pension will be based on the sum of one dollar ($1.00) per month for each year of Recognized Service; and Your Future Service Benefit depends on the monthly pension amount for that year as follows... May 1, 2019 and forward... If the Funded Percentage is 100% or more: Amount will be 1.60% of all Employer contributions... If the Funded Percentage is less than 80%: Amount will be 0.50% of all Employer contributions..." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 14, 5; 14, 9; 15, 2)

column2: "Life Annuity - If you are not married on the date you become entitled to receive a Regular Pension, your benefits will be paid in the form of a Life Annuity..." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 16, 1)
column3: "Retirement Payment Guarantee Feature (Modified Life Annuity) The 36-month guarantee feature (modified life annuity) included with the single life annuity will no longer be included as part of the normal benefit option... Now, the normal benefit option will be a life annuity only." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 9, 2)
column4: "The Single Life Annuity benefit amount payable to you on retirement..." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 10, 6)
column5: "Single Life Annuity with a 36 Month Guarantee. A Single Life Annuity is a monthly benefit for your life alone, followed by one of two death benefits. This form of benefit is the Plan’s Normal Retirement Benefit for non-married Participants..." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 19, 4)
column6: "If you are not married, your benefit will be paid as a Life Annuity with a three (3) year guarantee." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 22, 5)

column2: "50% Joint and Survivor Annuity with Pop-Up - If you are married on the date you become entitled to receive a Regular Pension, your benefit will be paid AUTOMATICALLY in the form of a 50% Joint and Survivor Annuity with Pop-Up." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 15, 2)
column3: "If you have been married for the 12-month period before your retirement, you must choose one of the spouse payment options — unless your spouse consents in writing to your choice of a Modified Life Annuity Option... The 36-month guarantee feature (modified life annuity) included with the single life annuity will no longer be included as part of the normal benefit option." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 50, 2; 9, 2)
column4: "The Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity (“Joint Pension”) is the normal form of benefit under the Plan for a married Participant... If you are married on the date of Normal or Early Retirement, you will receive a 50 percent Qualified Joint and Survivor Benefit..." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 10, 6-7)
column5: "The 50% Joint and Survivor Annuity form of benefit will apply automatically if you are married, unless you and your spouse expressly reject it on the proper Plan form..." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 19, 6)
column6: "If you are married and do not choose another option, your benefit will be paid as a fifty percent (50%) Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 22, 5)

column2: "50% Lump Sum Option... Qualified Optional Survivor Annuity... Life Annuity." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 16, 3-4)
column3: "In accordance with the Pension Protection Act of 2000, the Plan was amended to add a 75% joint and survivor annuity payment option (“75% survivor option”) for participants who retire on or after June 1, 2009." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 21, 3)
column4: "In lieu of the Joint Pension described above, you and your Spouse may elect a form of benefit called the 75% Qualified Optional Survival Annuity..." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 11, 2)
column5: "If you are married, and your spouse consents to waiving the Joint and Survivor Annuity, you may elect the Single Life Annuity or the 75% Joint and Survivor Annuity form." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 17, 3)
column6: "75% QUALIFIED JOINT AND SURVIVOR ANNUITY... SMALL BENEFIT LUMP SUM CASH-OUT UNDER $5,000." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 23, 3-5)

column2: "If you are MARRIED on the date you become entitled to receive a Disability Pension and your date of disability occurred on or after March 1, 2002, your pension AUTOMATICALLY will be paid in the form of a 50% JOINT AND SURVIVOR ANNUITY WITH POP-UP." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 13, 6)
column3: "For married participants who die before retirement with a vested benefit in the Plan, the benefit payable to the surviving spouse is based on the 50% joint-and-survivor payment option and in no case will 36 times the participant’s accrued benefit be a payment option." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 9, 4)
column4: "Your lawful Spouse will be eligible for a Pre-Retirement Survivor Annuity... (a) if you have earned a vested benefit and you die before attaining age 62, your Spouse will be entitled to a pension in an amount equal to one-half (½) the amount that would have been payable to you if you had separated from Covered Employment on the date of your death..." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 11, 5-6)
column5: "If you are married and are vested in your pension benefits and you die before retirement, your spouse is eligible for the Qualified Pre-Retirement Survivor Annuity (50% Survivor Annuity)." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 17, 4)
column6: "If you were married prior to death, your spouse may elect to receive the death benefit provided above to unmarried Employees or, if you were vested, your spouse may alternatively elect to receive fifty percent (50%) of the Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 10, 1)

column2: "If your surviving spouse meets the requirements for the Qualified Pre-Retirement Survivor Annuity and the Pre-Retirement Death Benefit, your surviving spouse may elect, in writing, to receive a lump sum distribution equal to the greater of (i) the actuarial value of the Qualified Pre-Retirement Survivor Annuity or (ii) the Pre-Retirement Death Benefit." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 20, 5)
column3: "The pre-retirement death benefit of 36 times the participant’s accrued benefit for unmarried participants will be eliminated." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 9, 3)
column4: "If a retired Area Six Participant dies, his or her surviving Spouse... or Beneficiary will... receive a single payment of $2,000..." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 61, 1)
column5: "DEATH BENEFITS FOR UNMARRIED PARTICIPANTS: This Plan provides death benefits to the designated beneficiary of a deceased participant." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 21, 3)
column6: "If you were not married prior to death and satisfy the required criteria, your designated beneficiary receives a lump sum equal to seven cents ($0.07) multiplied by your Hours of Service between January 1, 1968 and December 31, 1982, plus the sum of contributions made in each subsequent Plan Year on your behalf, subject to a maximum of $5,000.00." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 9, 5)

column2: "Yes. Your EARLY PENSION BENEFIT ONLY will be suspended if you work forty (40) or more hours per month in Covered Employment... If you work past age 62 and don’t start taking benefits, you will keep earning Pension Credits." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 17, 2; 7, 5)
column3: "If you are under age 62 your monthly pension payments will not be paid for any month in which you perform 40 or more hours of work in the industry. If you are between age 62 and 65 and you perform more than 1,000 hours of work in the industry in a plan year, your monthly pension payments will not be paid for any month in which you perform 40 or more hours of work in the industry... Monthly pension payments will not be suspended if you work in the industry after you reach age 65." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 64, 3-4; 65, 1)
column4: "You may work after retirement... If you are receiving pension benefit payment and you worked at least one (1) hour of Covered Employment in any Plan Year beginning on or after April 1, 1988, then so long as you are under age 65... you will continue to receive Credited Service. However, if you are over age 65, your benefits will be offset to take into account the in-service distribution of your Pension Benefits." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 9, 6; 10, 1)
column5: "If a Pensioner who retired on or after his or her Early Retirement Date returns to Employment in the Industry prior to age 65, his or her Pension Benefits shall be suspended until the Employee attains age 65 or again retires, whichever occurs first. If the Pensioner has returned to Covered Employment, he or she will accrue additional benefits." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 18, 2)
column6: "AFTER RETIREMENT – BETWEEN EARLY RETIREMENT AGE AND NORMAL RETIREMENT AGE: After you retire, any additional benefits you earn before you reach your Normal Retirement Age will be paid to you upon your subsequent retirement and termination of employment... AFTER RETIREMENT – AFTER NORMAL RETIREMENT AGE: If you return to work for a contributing Employer and you are beyond your Normal Retirement Age, then any new benefits you earn will be reduced (but not below zero) by the actuarial equivalent of actual pension benefits paid to you." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 27, 6-7)

column2: "The Trustees have taken action to restore hours for participants whose work was impacted negatively in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic... The Board of Trustees... has approved an increase in pension benefits for all active participants by 10%." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, 1, 3; SMM Feb 2017, 1, 2)
column3: "Following careful consideration, the Board of Trustees has decided to change the Fund administration from Welfare & Pension Administration Service, Inc. (WPAS) to Northwest Administrators, Inc. (NWA)... As communicated in the Notice of Critical Status that was sent to all Participants in a letter dated September 28, 2012... the Board of Trustees is required to adopt a Rehabilitation Plan to improve the funding of the Plan." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 3, 5; 5, 2)
column4: "In order to increase the pension benefits of union members and employees, certain employers and Local 2 negotiated a “4-Year $50 Window VII Benefit.”... effective October 1, 2021, certain employers and Local 2 negotiated a 5-Year Special Window VI Benefit and Special Permanent $40 Benefit." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, SMM p. 1, 8; SMM p. 3, 7)
column5: "Effective immediately, joint IRS and DOL emergency regulation requires the Plan to disregard the period from March 1, 2020 until sixty (60) days after the announced end of the National Emergency... (referred to as the “Outbreak Period”) for all Plan Participants, beneficiaries, or claimants in determining the following periods and dates... Required Minimum Age Change from Age 70 ½ to Age 72" (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, SMM June 2020, 1, 2; SMM June 2020, 2, 1)
column6: "May 1, 2019 and forward Amount dependent on Plan’s PPA Market Value Funded Percentage (“Funded Percentage”)... If the Funded Percentage is 100% or more: Amount will be 1.60%..." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 14, 9)

column2: "If your application is denied, you have 180 days to request a review... If you request review of your application for a Regular or Early Pension, your written request must be submitted to the Trustees within sixty (60) days after you receive notice that your application was denied..." (Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan - SPD 2020 & SMMs.pdf, Notice p. 1, 3; 22, 10)
column3: "If your claim for a pension benefit is denied... you have a right... to appeal any denial, all within certain time schedules... The Board of Trustees will notify you of its determination on review within a reasonable period of time, not more than 60 days after receiving your request for review." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 8, 2; 61, 4)
column4: "Any person whose application for benefits under the Plan has been denied in whole or in part by the Board of Trustees, or whose claim to benefits is otherwise denied by the Board, shall be notified of such decision in writing by the Board of Trustees within 90 days (or 45 days for disability claims)... A petition for review of a denial or adverse benefit determination shall be... filed with or received by the Board of Trustees within 60 days (or 180 days for disability claims) after the date shown on the notice..." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 64, 2; 65, 2)
column5: "The notice of denial shall be given within ninety (90) days after the claim is filed... The claimant, or claimant's duly authorized representative may request a review of the claim denial by filing a written application for such review within sixty (60) days after receipt of the written notification of the denial... The decision on review will be in writing and, if your appeal is denied, will include specific reason(s) for the denial." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 32, 2; 32, 4; 27, 7)
column6: "The notice of denial shall be given within ninety (90) days after the claim is filed... The claimant, or claimant's duly authorized representative may request a review of the claim denial by filing a written application for such review within sixty (60) days after receipt of the written notification of the denial." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 32, 2; 32, 4)

column3: "If you have a claim for benefits which is denied or ignored, in whole or in part, you may file suit in state or federal court subject to the exhaustion of the Plan’s Benefit Claim and Appeal Procedures." (UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund - SPD 2005 & Notices.pdf, 8, 2)
column4: "A statement of the Claimant’s right to file a civil action under Section 502(a) of ERISA." (San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2018 & SMMs.pdf, 65, 1)
column5: "There is no mandatory arbitration of any denied claim or appeal. The parties may mutually agree on arbitration but that is voluntary only." (Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan - SPD 2016 & SMM.pdf, 27, 7)
column6: "MANDATORY ARBITRATION AND CLASS ACTION WAIVER... Arbitration is the exclusive remedy for all claims, disputes, or breaches arising out of or in any way relating to the Plan... The Plan also specifically prohibits class arbitration and class action lawsuits regarding all claims, disputes, or breaches arising out of or in any way relating to the Plan or Plan documents." (San Diego UNITE-HERE Pension Plan - SPD 2020.pdf, 33, 3-6)
